name: yarn production, silk, long fibre | yarn, silk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21312/documentation

Inventory refers to 1 kg twisted yarn ready for weaving ;This dataset covers all relevant input and output flows of the represented gate to gate unit process with a good overall data quality. The inventory is mainly based on industry data. The dataset represents the regional average of Silk yarn  production process. Silk thread, also called yarn, is formed by throwing, or twisting, the reeled silk. As the silk filaments are reeled onto bobbins, they are twisted in a particular manner to achieve a certain texture of yarn. For instance, "singles" consist of several filaments which are twisted together in one direction. They are turned tightly for sheer fabrics and loosely for thicker fabrics. Combinations of singles and untwisted fibers may be twisted together in certain patterns to achieve desired textures of fabrics such as crepe de chine, voile, or tram. Fibers may also be manufactured in different patterns for use in the nap of fabrics, for the outside, or for the inside of the fabric.;The silk yarn is put through rollers to make the width more uniform. The yarn is inspected, weighed, and packaged. Finally, the yarn is shipped to fabric manufacturers.;;

Activity starts from reeled raw silk as input


This activity ends with produced 1 kg  yarn which is ready for weaving.
Machinery is excluded.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Reeling centre run by government was chosen to provide data based on its technical representativeness of the current state of business and their willingness to participate.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Each cocoon is made up of a filament between 600 and 900 meters long. Nine cocoons are reeled togetehr to form a 20 denier filament at the reeling stage. Four of these super-fine filaments are doubled together to make one yarn on doubling machine and wound on to spools. This filament is then twisted in next operation and then wound into skeins.  ;since this dataset reflects a handloom process, there are no machinery modelled
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data has been obtained from a Silk reeling and spinning plant located in Hoshangabad in the state of Madhya Pradesh (Central India) based on the representativeness of currently used technology,

exchanges.description: There is no coproduct or waste being generated here. Since, reeled silk is simply doubled up and rereeled in this process. No recircularisation either.
